H560.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1841.def: = man; ► {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}; one of the family heads who accompanied {L:Ezra<SDBH:עֶזְרָא>} back to {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} after the exile; one of the signatories to the {L:covenant<SDBH:בְּרִית>} document of {L:Nehemiah<SDBH:נְחֶמְיָה>}

H560.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2927.def: = process by which animals find shade and cover in a certain place

H613.def: = a flat, thin strip of metal material used to tie objects to other objects; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else

H6211.def: = smallish brown or gray moth that lays eggs in clothing or other cloth; eggs hatch into very small caterpillars, which feed on the fibers; ◄ Tineidae family, probably Tineola biselliella; ≈ symbols of decay, ruin, and slow destruction

H606.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; ≈ associated with mortality

H607.def: = referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

H8450.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H560.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4431.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer guidance and recommendations to humans to help them take the right decisions

H6665.def: = pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard

H2604.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly
